answer: Honey, you're screaming.

question: She hot?

question: I'll put a pillowcase over my head.

answer: She's cheating on Joey with Ross!
question: Oh my God, that's Charlie!

question: ooh...

question: Sure...

question: Hey!

answer: This is what I want to do.

question: Or "Win, Lose or Draw".

answer: You guys just keep getting cooler and cooler!
question: Ross and I *always* wanted to be Donny and Marie.

answer: Who?
question: So weird to see all these people again... Oh my God, look, there's Geoffrey Cleric.

answer: (looking around) Did I go to this school?
question: He was roommates with John Rosoff. He went out with Andrea Tamburino. She dumped him for Michael Skloff.

question: Hey, there's Missy Goldberg. You gotta remember her.

answer: You're right, by saying "nice" I'm virtually licking her.

answer: Are you asking permission to break the pact?

question: Thanks to a little something called "Helvetica Bold 24 point"!

answer: Hey!
question: Hey guys!

question: Hey, Missy...

question: Boss!

answer: Totally. I had sex in High school...
question: Woha! Wait... What are we doing? What we have is too important to mess it up over some girl. I mean, we can get laid anytime we want.

answer: All right, I'd say we make a pact. *Neither* of us will go out with Missy Goldberg.
question: Me too. I'm good at it.

answer: All right, so that's Missy Goldberg, Phoebe Cates and Molly Ringwald, who neither of us can go out with.
question: You got it.

answer: Oh, and Sheena Easton. But we probably couldn't get her anyway.
question: Those are the pacts!

answer: Your hands are shaking.

answer: Ross, that was 16 years ago!
question: You broke the *pact*!

answer: I believe the foundation of our friendship was unfortunate hair. (Ross just stares at him) All right, look, if we're really gonna do this... it's not like *you* never broke one of the pacts.
question: That doesn't matter! We're talking about the foundation of our friendship.

answer: Oh really?
question: I didn't.

answer: Oh really!?
question: No.

answer: ADRIENNE TURNER!! (A girl behind them turns around)
question: NO!

answer: Oh please, and *you knew* how much I liked her.

answer: Aren't you...?

question: Yeah, Rachel. And this (points to Monica) is Ross' sister, Monica. We met at Thanksgiving. (looks around the room as if searching for something more interesting to do).

answer: Hi Monica.
question: Bitchin'

question: Hi Chandler. It's really nice to see you (rolls her eyes) NOT. (she and Rachel giggle a little and Chandler looks unimpressed)

answer: Look (hands him a drink) it was a lo-o-ong time ago.
question: (looks disappointed in himself) Man... I... I'm sorry.

answer: Not her!

answer: Well maybe if you go to school here next year we can totally hang out.

answer: I'm in college and I'm in a band.
question: Oh well, You know, I think it's kinda really important that I go somewhere where there's sun, so I'm sort of... (Chandler leans in an kisses her) (She pulls away) Hey!

question: Oh my God! That's wild!

answer: Why?

answer: Oh wait... *What* bed did you say she was on?
question: Okay, after you told me she was passed out in our room, I went in there to make sure she was all right. She was lying on my bed, all buried in peoples coats. Well, I went to kiss her on the forehead, you know. But it was *so* dark, I accidentally got her lips. I started to pull away, but then I felt her start to kiss me back. It was only for a second, but... it was amazing. And now, now I find out that *you* kissed her first.

answer: I'm pretty sure I put her on *my* bed.
question: Mine.

answer: Why would I kiss a girl, and then put her on your bed?
question: No, she was definitely on my bed.

answer: You look great. I'm so glad we're having this rehearsal dinner, you know, I so rarely get to practice my meals before I eat them.
question: Hey!

answer: No stupid jokes. I thought that was for the actual wedding.

answer: Heh.
question: Uhm... you haven't told these guys what they're doing in the wedding yet.

answer: This is like figure skating team all over again. (Phoebe and Ross glare at him astonished) I mean synchronized swimming. (they continue to glare) I mean- I mean the balance beam. (to Ross) Help me!
question: Oh, man!

answer: Thank you.
question: FOOTBALL!

answer: I know, I hate being left out of things.
question: I can't believe we're gonna be the only people that aren't in this wedding.

answer: Fine. We're just sitting here. Alone. Doing nothing. It's our rehearsal for tomorrow.
question: Hey guys, how is it going?

answer: What happened?
question: Yeah look, about tomorrow, I... I've got a question for ya. I just found out that one of my groomsmen had had an emergency and can't make it.

answer: (standing up too) M-Me-me-me!
question: I'll do it!

answer: Pick me, I look great in a tux and I will not steal focus.

answer: You are going downer!
question: Please, you're going down!

question: Is that what they say on the Figure Skating Team?

answer: Mike didn't tell you? You have to chose one of us to be in your wedding. One of his groomsmen fell out.
question: I decided to pee.

answer: Just not enough to put us in the original wedding party.
question: Oh no, no. I can't choose between you two! I love you both so much!

answer: Hey, can I talk to you about this groomsman thing? If you pick Ross, he'll walk you down the isle just fine. But if you choose me, you'll be getting some comedy!
question: Hi

answer: Let me tell you why you need to pick me. (Goes to sit on the couch facing backwards to the kitchen. Rachel gets a chair and sits opposite him) See, when I was a kid, I was always left out of everything, you know, and it really made me feel... insecure. You know, I was always picked last in gym. Even behind that big fat exchange student who didn't even know the rules to baseball. I mean, this guy would strike out and then run to third. Anyway, If I'm the only one left out of this wedding, I just know that all those feelings are gonna come rushing back.
question: Even so, I think I'm gonna pick Ross.

answer: (Getting up and raising his fist in victory) Y-Y-YEEESSS! Make "groom" for Chandler.
question: All right fine, I pick you.

answer: (smiling to himself too) That's what I was doing too.

answer: You too.
question: (barely containing himself at this point) Well, you have fun tonight.

answer: I'm not supposed to tell you.

answer: I'll tell you at the wedding.

answer: So technically, would this person be in the wedding?

answer: I'm not scared. (moves towards Mike and Chappy) I'll just take little Chappy and... (he backs out) HE CAN SENSE MY FEAR. MY THROAT IS EXPOSED.

question: Honey.

answer: Monica. Calm, self.

answer: I'll bet his dad doesn't think so.
question: No... he killed his father with a shovel. (Monica and Chandler's jaws drop) But other than that, he's a great guy.

answer: Of course I'm awake. Assume from now on that I'm always awake! (He turns the light on)

answer: I'd keep an eye on him! We *have* to find out which one the father is.

answer: I dunno, aren't there tests for these things, right?

answer: (struggling) Oh, really?

answer: O-okay. (steps closer to Monica and speaks softly) So, is she gonna take the test?

question: Nope, she doesn't have to, I found out who the father is.

answer: How do you know?
question: (smiling) No it's not.

answer: Oh God! What was it? The thing that we hardly ever do or the thing we *never* do?
question: Well, it turns out that Erica didn't pay much attention in Sex Ed class, because the thing she did with that prison guy... it'd be pretty hard to make a baby that way.

answer: (nods in appreciation) Shovely Joe!
question: The thing we never do.

answer: Yeah, I don't know why we hang out with married couples more often.
question: Oh! Yeah, this is fun, couples night.

answer: You mean that Portuguese couple? Yeah, like you wouldn't have done it. (she shrugs)
question: Well, because every time we do, you make jokes about swinging and scare them away.

answer: Damn it.
question: You know what? You are my friends, I wanna be supportive, I will come with you. SHOTGUN!

answer: That's what we were gonna name the baby.
question: Wrong again! Apparently you can change it to anything you want. So I thought, all right, here's an opportunity to be creative. So meet Princess Consuela Banana Hammock.

answer: You know, I always feel that way after an interview. I'll bet it went better than you think.

answer: That is a bad interview.
question: Well, I didn't get the job at Gucci and I got fired from Ralph Lauren.

answer: Ooh! Israeli champagne. And it's vanilla!

question: ...that center around work.

answer: And thank you for explaining to us what escrow means... I've already forgotten what you said, but thank you.

question: Me too. Yeah, this place is great. I'm so happy for you guys. Although, you know, I hope you like fungus.

answer: When your head was hanging out the window, it didn't hit a mailbox, did it?

answer: Man, those two dogs are going *at it*!

answer: Hey.
question: (entering) Hey!

answer: Really? What changed your mind?
question: Oh, just er... you know, looking around. But you know what? This house... is great.

answer: Joey, there *was* a little girl who lived here, but she died like 30 years ago.
question: Oh well, the little girl who lives here made me feel a lot better about the whole thing.

answer: Ha! I'm just messing with you.
question: (frightened) What?

answer: You don't think we'd buy a house and not have a Joey room do you?
question: What? I get my own room?

answer: It's seven years ago. (he looks surprised) My time machine works!

answer: Excuse me?
question: So what if he wants to sleep with her? I mean, she's single and he's cute.

answer: For your information, I was staring at her baby. We're about to be parents.

answer: How did the job stuff go?
question: Should we send something?

answer: That's great!
question: He offered me one.

answer: So we thought we'd throw you little going away party around seven.
question: Hey!

answer: Where's your passport?
question: Oh my God! I have nothing left to teach you! (they hug)

answer: Well, it's not.
question: It should be right next to my plane ticket.

answer: We're taking a break!
question: Are, are you kidding? *This* is packing?

answer: Jumping on the bed?
question: From?

answer: No, no, no, guys. She's right. We should get to work. I'll take stuff out of the closet, Joey you pack 'em and Ross you re-pack whatever Joey packs.
question: You got it! (Monica leaves, Ross closes the door). All right, she's right, we gotta get serious. (He grabs a bag of styrofoam peanuts) Let's put styrofoam peanuts down his pants and kick him!

answer: I didn't know Monica had these!
question: Chandler, you don't have a sister so you can't understand how much this bums me out.

question: Mhm, maybe she used them with another boyfriend. Maybe Richard!

answer: Hey.

question: Oh, man! I can't believe she's actually leaving. How am I gonna say goodbye to Rachel?

answer: Yes, Joe?
question: Who loses fifty seven coin tosses in a row? Head she wins, tails I lose. (he stops and starts realizing something) Wait a minute...

question: That would be a *terrible* punishment. But, I'm serious, I've never seen these before.

answer: (he doesn't look excited anymore). Well played.

question: I really made you think about that thing uh?

answer: No, no, no... They're really yours. We... found them in your old room.
question: (laughs) Oh, I'm sure gonna miss pretending to laugh at your weird jokes that I don't get.

question: Well, these aren't mine. Maybe Monica used to use them with...

question: Oh honey...

answer: Ooh, not so tight... (blows raspberry, and the hug ends) I'm sorry, just give me one more chance.

answer: I'm sor... Just go. Just go. I can't, I can't.

answer: Oh, you're definately not. I haven't cried like that in years.

answer: That old woman was being scammed by her mechanic.

answer: Mine was a humdinger
question: Yeah. Mine too.

answer: Well, you can't say we don't know how to throw a party.
question: Tell me about it.

answer: Joey and I can finish up in the guest room.

question: Oh no! You and Phoebe are gonna help me in here.

answer: Honey, it's gonna be okay.

question: Chandler, wait, wait, wait...

answer: Relax! We'll just get her some antacids.
question: Oh my God!

question: She doesn't have a stomach-ache. She's in labor!
